title: The Wildhearts live, somehow: the hair-raising adventures of rock's most dysfunctional band
text:
The Wildhearts were once tipped for greatness – then the self-destruction began. What went wrong? Plenty, they tell Ian Winwood

Prior to rejoining The Wildhearts, bassist Danny McCormack lost a leg. The incident occurred after the 47-year old injected a cocktail of cocaine and amphetamines into his groin, severing his femoral artery. Blood spurted 15 feet into the air, staining the ceiling and window of the room in which he found himself. Admitted to the Freeman Hospital in Newcastle, he watched as three of his toes turned black, became gangrenous and fell off. Surgeons amputated his leg below the knee.

“My wife saved my life,” he says. “She put a credit card over the hole and called an ambulance....
description: The Wildhearts were once tipped for greatness – then the self-destruction began.
